definition: Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]

sentences.english: The oleanders are planted in the gardens as the ornamental flowers.
sentences.chinese: 夹竹桃被许多人当做观赏花养在家里啊。

sentences.english: From then on, I loved the oleanders morethanever .

sentences.chinese: 许多人很高兴认识夹竹桃。

sentences.english: I love oleander more from now on.
I especially like the oleander in moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 我特别喜欢月光下的夹竹桃。

sentences.english: I stretched my hands out of the fence and could pitched the top of the oleander.
sentences.chinese: 我伸手到栏外，就可以抓到夹竹桃的顶枝。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, the wonder of oleander is not confined to its toughness alone.
sentences.chinese: 但是夹竹桃的妙处还不止于此。

sentences.english: I could catch the top branch of oleander if I stretched my hand out from the railing.
sentences.chinese: 我伸手到栏外，就可以抓到夹竹桃的顶枝。

sentences.english: Objective To study the activity of water extract of Nerium indicum Mill.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究夹竹桃水提物的灭螺活性。

sentences.english: Standing upstairs, I could easily reached the heightshoots of oleanders as long as I stretched out my hands.
sentences.chinese: 我伸手到栏外，就可以抓到夹竹桃的顶枝。

sentences.english: North American plant similar to common dogbane.
sentences.chinese: 北美的一种类似夹竹桃的植物。

sentences.english: The Hibiscus, Azalea and Oleander are some common shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 大红花，杜鹃和夹竹桃是一些常见的灌木。

definition: balsam/Balsaminaceae (a flower family including Impatiens balsamina)/touch-me-not/busy Lizzie
tuberose/Cestrum nocturnum, see also 夜香木
